newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico-U.S. border wins NAFTA project funding.
newsitem.headline: Mexico-U.S. border wins NAFTA project funding.

text.p: Mexico's Finance Ministry said Saturday that the North American Development Bank has approved the first finance packages for two water projects on the U.S.-Mexico border.

The border region was earmarked for special attention and funding under the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) between Mexico, the United States and Canada, especially for environmental infrastructure projects.
No figures were given for the amounts of the packages, which are both on the Mexican side of the border.
The first is a credit to partially finance a system of water storage and treatment of waste water in the town of Naco in the state of Sonora.
The second is for partial credit guarantees for a waste water treatment plant for an industrial corridor in Matamoros, in the state of Tamaulipas.
Other Mexican border towns that are earmarked for project finance are Nogales, Piedras Negras, Puerto Penasco, Ciudad Juarez, Mexicali, Tijuana, Nuevo Laredo and Ensenada.
U.S. towns that are listed to receive funding are Brawley in California, Mercedes in Texas and Somerton in Arizona, the ministry added.
